paper_abstract: We face the job shop scheduling problem with sequence dependent setup times and makespan minimization by memetic algorithm. This algorithm combines a classic genetic algorithm with a local searcher. The performance of the local searcher relies on the combination of a tabu search algorithm with a neighborhood structure termed N (S) that are thoroughly described and analyzed. Also, two evolution models are considered: Lamarckian and Baldwinian evolution. We report results from an experimental study across conventional benchmark instances showing that the proposed algorithm outperforms the current state-of-the-art methods and that Lamarckian evolution is better than Baldwinian evolution.
paper_title: A competent memetic algorithm for complex scheduling
